docs.snippet: An investigation determined there was no evidence that Gov. Tom Corbett tried to slow the Jerry Sandusky sexual-abuse case at Penn State for political purposes as he ran for the office....
docs.lead_paragraph: An investigation determined there was no evidence that Gov. Tom Corbett tried to slow the Jerry Sandusky sexual-abuse case at Penn State for political purposes as he ran for the office.
docs.abstract: Inquiry by Pennsylvania attorney general's office finds that Gov Tom Corbett may have taken longer than he should have to investigate claims of sexual abuse by former Penn State football assistant Jerry Sandusky, but there is no evidence that he tried to slow the case for political purposes.

headline.main: Inquiry Finds No Political Pacing of Sandusky Case
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Finds No Political Pacing of Sandusky Case

docs.snippet: With the stoppage time rule, soccer, a timed game, actually ends only when the referee decides it has ended....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the stoppage time rule, soccer, a timed game, actually ends only when the referee decides it has ended.
docs.abstract: Vagaries of time are the norm in soccer; with stoppage time rule, games do not end when a clock expires, but only when the referee decides they are over; latest example came in World Cup game when United States took lead in 81st minute of 90-minute match, only to see the advantage slip away when Portugal scored 14 minutes later.

headline.seo: Stoppage Time in the World Cup Underscores Soccer’s Strange Rules
headline.main: In Time Warp of Soccer, It Ain’t Over Till ... Who Knows?
headline.print_headline: In the Time Warp of Soccer, It Ain’t Over Till ... Who Knows?
